intro: Tragacantha pseudocaspia, commonly known as the Persian gum tree, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces a valuable gum, known as tragacanth, which is used in various industries, including pharmaceuticals and food. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperature fluctuations. Tragacantha pseudocaspia plays an important ecological role in stabilizing desert environments.
